subPoints: General - choices behind the plot(s) were well done, resulting in clear and informative data presentation
Color palette - well chosen

positive.mainPoint: The plot details were good regarding
subPoints: axis labels
color
font size
legend
line style
line thickness
point style
point size
title
units
The choices behind the plot creation were generally good, but there is some room for improvement.
Plotting data - data was not visualized/plotted.
Plot type(s) - poorly chosen. It would have been more appropriate to plot the data as:
Related plots/data - do not have the same axis range, preventing direct comparisons.
Too Many Plots: Combining the data into a single (or a reduced number) plots would have been a more concise presentation and allowed easier comparison.
Data Overload: The amount of data presented in a single plot was excessive (too many series/variables), leading to clutter. Consider separating the data.
Axis labels - missing or incomplete
Legend - missing when multiple data series are present
Units - missing on axis labels or title
Title - plot title is missing

negative.mainPoint: Poor Choice or Execution of Elements
subPoints: Axis labels - insufficient detail, misleading, or poorly positioned.
Color choice - poor contrast, non-intuitive mapping, or unsuitable for colorblind viewers.
Font size - too small/large, significantly impacting readability.
Line/point styles - confusingly similar or inappropriate for the data type.
Line styles - a different thickness would have been more appropriate.
Point styles - a different size would have been more appropriate.
